Key Arguments: The legislation would create a bureaucratic committee with excessive power to determine what constitutes a genuine contribution to community debate.
The committee would have the power to prosecute and impose penalties without appropriate legal recourse.
Social media platforms would be indirectly regulated, leading to self-censorship to avoid penalties.
The legislation is seen as an attempt to regulate and control free speech.
The government could manipulate the committee to favor its political intentions, exempting itself from scrutiny.
The scope of 'harm' as defined in the legislation is too broad and vague, potentially stifling debate on contentious issues.
Notable Quotes: In short it would be the sole arbiter of the truth!
The legislation is a brazenly outrageous attempt to regulate free speech.
It is vital this legislation must be opposed, to endorse it would effectively succumb to surrendering free speech as we know it.
